ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class exposed me to texts that will be incredibly useful for the rest of my academic career. I appreciated and will try to emulate Professor Bradley's approach to close-reading text and images in the future.
I learned how to read and think critically on philosophy, contemporary art, technology, black studies, and media theory.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: - brilliant, engaging professor - good overall class dynamic - well-chosen, challenging readings and artworks Weaknesses: - time management - no midterm feedback

The course is exceptionally well-organized, and Professor Bradley is immensely thoughtful, sharp, and articulate. She is a force of nature and brought such sophistication, depth, and freshness to continental philosophy and media theory. Also, Professor Bradley is very good at fostering interesting seminar discussions among students--many voices were heard from, encouraged, and engaged with.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone interested in media studies, media philosophy, or contemporary art.
Yes! Its a great introduction to race and new media. Grateful for this course. Definitely would recommend to other graduate students.

I HIGHLY recommend to take any class with Professor Bradley. She's brilliant and has endlessly interesting ideas and analyses on such cutting-edge adn important topics to society--contemporary art, media, philosophy, and technology.
